Due to the very rigorous safety procedures surrounding the anaesthetic process in France, including its legal framework, mortality directly attributable to anaesthesia has been considerably reduced since the 1990s. It has fallen from 1 death attributable to anaesthesia for every 10,000 anaesthesias (in the early 1980s), to one death for every 150,000 (1999), and is currently around 1/200,000.

question.question: What has been the trend in mortality directly attributable to anaesthesia in France since the 1990s?
question.option_a: Mortality has increased from 1 in 10,000 to 1 in 50,000
question.option_b: Mortality has decreased from 1 in 10,000 to 1 in 200,000
question.option_c: Mortality has remained stable at 1 in 50,000
question.option_d: Mortality has increased from 1 in 10,000 to 1 in 20,000
